basics.name: Archana Warrier
basics.label: Computer Science Masters Student
basics.summary: Computer Science Masters Student at Technische Universität Kaiserslautern. Research interests in AI systems for scientific reasoning, probabilistic inference, and world model learning.

work.name: Basis, New York
work.summary: Contributing to Project MARA (Modeling, Abstraction, and Reasoning Agents).

work.name: DFKI, Kaiserslautern
work.summary: Conducted research on probabilistic inference methods and Bayesian machine learning. Served as teaching assistant for the ``Machine Learning in Julia'' course.

work.name: Columbia University, New York
work.summary: Developed a framework that automatically constructs simplified model abstractions to balance computational accuracy with resource constraints.

work.name: Columbia University, New York
work.summary: Implemented parametric inversion in JAX — a program transformation technique that inverts non-injective functions by introducing parameters to uniquely determine inputs. Demonstrated approach on simulation models, including Lotka-Volterra dynamics.

work.name: Google Summer of Code
work.summary: Developed CounterfactualFairness.jl package for counterfactual reasoning methods for algorithmic fairness. Implemented multiple fairness criteria, including counterfactual fairness and path-specific effects.

volunteer.summary: Conducted workshops and organized technical events for the student community.
Supported students in the Level 0 advanced mathematics program.

awards.title: Top 300, National Programming and Data Science Qualifier
awards.summary: Achieved 95% score in the national programming and data science qualifier.

awards.title: Letter of Appreciation
awards.awarder: Union Minister of India, Smriti Irani
awards.summary: Received a letter of appreciation from the Union Minister of India.

awards.title: Bronze Medal, International Olympiad of Mathematics
awards.summary: Awarded bronze medal in the International Olympiad of Mathematics.

publications.name: Benchmarking World-Model Learning
publications.summary: Designed the AutumnBench benchmark for evaluating world model building in interactive agents. Project website: autumn.basis.ai

publications.name: Had Enough of Experts? Elicitation and Evaluation of Bayesian Priors from LLMs
publications.summary: Co-authored work on eliciting and evaluating Bayesian priors from Large Language Models.

projects.name: AutumnBench
projects.summary: Developed a framework and becnhmark for evaluating world model building in interactive agents.

projects.name: Rational Abstraction
projects.summary: Developed a framework for rational abstraction, a technique for creating simplified model abstractions to balance computational accuracy with resource constraints.

projects.name: CounterfactualFairness.jl
projects.summary: Developed a Julia package for counterfactual reasoning methods for algorithmic fairness, implementing multiple fairness criteria.

projects.name: ProbMods in Omega.jl
projects.summary: Developed a translation of ProbMods (probmods.org) in Omega.jl, a probabilistic programming language.

projects.name: Parametric Inversion in JAX
projects.summary: Implemented a program transformation technique that inverts non-injective functions by introducing parameters to uniquely determine inputs.
